paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on a novel somatic BRCA2 point mutation in a metastatic pancreatic cancer patient.

individual_records.phenotype_details: metastatic pancreatic cancer with progressive disease after chemotherapy
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The patient achieved a PFS for ~ 6.5 months following olaparib combination and monotherapy.

functional_data.summary: The mutation is hypothesized to cause a structural abnormality in the BRCA2 protein, resulting in defective DNA double strand break repair.

variants.segregation_data: Not applicable as this is a single case report.
variants.additional_notes: The mutation was confirmed as somatic and not detected in white blood cells.
key_quotes: We describe a patient carrying a novel somatic BRCA2 p. I2315T point mutation, which is first reported in metastatic pancreatic cancer.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper focused on a single case with a specific BRCA2 variant.
